items.title: Exercise 1: SLA Performance Review (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Monthly Vendor Performance Review: OfficeClean Ltd.

Agreement Start Date: 1st Jan | Review Period: March

SLA Requirements:
- Daily cleaning of all common areas (Target: 100% | Actual: 95%).
- Response to emergency spills within 60 minutes (Target: 100% | Actual: 80%).
- Supply of recycled paper products (Target: 100% | Actual: 100%).

Findings:
The vendor failed to meet the emergency response SLA on two occasions this month. The reported lead time for restocking soap dispensers also increased from 24 to 48 hours. It is essential that the account manager provide a corrective action plan by Wednesday. We recommend that the contract be reviewed if performance does not improve by the next quarterly meeting.

questions.question: Which SLA target did OfficeClean Ltd fail to meet most significantly?
questions.explanation: Actual performance for emergency spills was only 80%, compared to 95% for daily cleaning.

questions.question: What is the requirement for the account manager?
options: To provide a corrective action plan by Wednesday
questions.explanation: Doc A states: 'It is essential that the account manager provide a corrective action plan by Wednesday.'

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Procurement Lifecycle. Which stage involves identifying potential suppliers for a specific need?
items.explanation: Sourcing is the initial stage of identifying suppliers.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Supply Chain Metrics. What does 'Lead Time' measure?
options: The time between starting and finishing a process
items.explanation: Lead time is the duration between initiation and completion.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Operational Chunks. Complete the sentence: 'We need to ___ the new IT vendor for ___ compliance before we sign the contract.'
items.explanation: Standard procedure is to 'vet a vendor' for 'data security compliance'.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: The Subjunctive. Correct the error in this formal sentence: 'It is essential that the supplier provides a new quote.'
items.modelAnswer: It is essential that the supplier provide a new quote.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: The Subjunctive. Use the verb 'be' to complete this formal requirement: 'It is important that the contract ___ reviewed by the Legal department.'
items.modelAnswer: It is important that the contract be reviewed by the Legal department.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Data. Based on Doc A, identify two areas where the vendor failed to meet the agreed standards.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Emergency spill response (80% vs 100%). 2. Lead time for soap dispenser restocking (increased to 48 hours).

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. How would you professionally inform a vendor that you are unhappy with their current lead times?
options: We are concerned about the recent increase in lead times; would you be able to investigate this?
I suggest that you be faster.
items.explanation: This is polite, uses professional vocabulary ('concerned', 'investigate'), and asks for a resolution diplomatically.

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Contract Renewal Email. Write a short email (50-70 words) to a courier company asking for their updated price list as you are considering renewing their contract for another year.
items.modelAnswer: Hi FastTrack Couriers, we are currently reviewing our logistics requirements for the upcoming year and are considering renewing our contract with you. Could you please provide your updated price list and any new terms for 2024? It is essential that we receive this information by Friday to complete our vetting process. Thanks, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: SLA Terminology. What does 'SLA' stand for in a business contract?
items.explanation: SLA (Service Level Agreement) defines the level of service expected from a vendor.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Briefing. Record a 2-minute audio briefing explaining the importance of 'Vendor Vetting' to a junior administrator. Use the subjunctive once (e.g., 'It is vital that they...').
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Clarity, Explanation of Vetting, Correct use of Subjunctive.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Negotiation. Record a 60-second clip of you negotiating with a vendor. Use 'We require that...' or 'It is a requirement that...' followed by a subjunctive verb.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Professional negotiation, Use of Subjunctive, Focus on terms/SLA.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Vendor Recommendation Report (Portfolio). Write a 150-word report recommending a new catering vendor for the office. Use procurement vocabulary and at least two subjunctive structures.
items.modelAnswer:
Vendor Recommendation: FreshEat Catering

After a thorough sourcing and vetting process, I recommend that FreshEat Catering be selected as our primary food vendor. We have vetted three suppliers based on price, quality, and their commitment to sustainability.

FreshEat offers a competitive price point and their lead time for event bookings is only 48 hours. Furthermore, their SLA includes a 100% guarantee on organic sourcing. It is essential that the contract be signed before the end of the month to ensure they can begin service by Q3. We also require that the account manager provide a dedicated contact for our monthly audits.

Not only is their menu superior, but they also meet all our internal compliance requirements regarding health and safety. I recommend that Legal review the final agreement by Friday EOD.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: Purchase Order (PO) Template. Complete a PO for '10 Ergonomic Chairs'. Include: Vendor, Item Description, Quantity, Unit Price, Total, and Requested Delivery Date.
items.modelAnswer: Vendor: OfficeFurniture Ltd. Item: Ergonomic Desk Chairs (Model A). Qty: 10. Unit Price: £150. Total: £1,500. Delivery Date: 22nd May.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) Define 'Procurement'. 2) What is an SLA? 3) Complete the subjunctive: 'It is urgent that he ___ (arrive) for the meeting.' 4) What is 'Vetting'?
items.modelAnswer: 1) The process of obtaining goods or services. 2) Service Level Agreement. 3) ...arrive... (base form). 4) A background check on a supplier or person.
